title: "_____ isn't op. your entire team just has to put all their effort into stopping him all game."
body: i will strangle you with your own neck

replies.body: how df do u strangle one with their own neck o.O
I could show you... but only once.
I've seen people being beaten to death with their own skull

That's nothing.

Wait until you see yourself getting beat to death with your own skull.

THEN you have a story to tell.
But...people die when they're killed...

You got me caught between 2 jokes here...  I'll let you choose.

1.  Only once.
2.  You wanna see the show, kid... you gotta pay the price.
"It's fine for Yi to have over 3k HP and 3v1 your team because your team has to waste every single cooldown of him to stop him!"

> [{quoted}](name=Hayaishi2,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=scLHBwEj,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2016-01-31T23:34:13.310+0000)
>
> "It's fine for Yi to have over 3k HP and 3v1 your team because your team has to waste every single cooldown of him to stop him!"

If your team didn't bring hard CC or can't use it.. then yeah.  Whenever you see no CC or very little CC on an enemy team that's the time to go Yi, Kat, Vayne etc....

They aren't OP just they are being played into an obvious weakness.  Before you say "Well CC stops everyone so its not a counter."  Some champs thrive in a low CC environment. 

Nasus or Veigar are examples are champs where your team does need to work together to stop.  They are weak early and powerful late.... you can either delay them or win quickly... choosing to do neither is not the champ being OP its your team not realizing that certain champs cannot be left alone too long.
This man needs more upvotes. More than the people who complain about a champion without listing their strengths and weaknesses.
*cough {{champion:114}} cough

http://orig03.deviantart.net/b26d/f/2009/209/1/6/shaked_bart_by_lesharc.jpg

Feel better now?
"Oh, this champ isn't OP, another champ has a favorable match up against them!"
"oh this champ isn't OP, just use all of your teams CC on them"
"X Champ isn't OP when they're dead"
How does one strangle you with your own neck?
Violently.
..Or her? fuckin Illinois {{champion:420}}
As a {{champion:157}}  main, I beg to differ. Nothing except an ezreal mid makes me happier than seeing an illaoi. I just destroy her in lane.
Yeah but you play Yasuo

This man has a fair point.... get outta here and stop having opinions you dirty Yasuo main!

... seriously tho, Yasuo is poorly designed garbage, him being able to slap around Illaoi doesn't really mean much in the grand scheme of things.
Does her attrocious win rate mean anything in the grand scheme of things?

Play Rate: 3.72%(18th most popular toplaner)
Winrate: 45.4(Rock bottom)
Not too popular, and has a terrible winrate. I think she's not that bad, maybe even underpowered.
Sources: http://champion.gg/champion/Illaoi

How to strangle someone with their own neck.
1) Throw them down to the ground
2) Tear out their esophagus with your bear hands. Violently.
3) Rap esophagus around the remaining of their neck.
4) Pull tightly.

 If done correctly, they will be choked successfully before they can die from the trauma of missing their esophagus. 
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
How is it that you can spell "esophagus" correctly but not "bare" or  "wrap" ?

> 2) Tear out their esophagus with your bear hands. Violently.

...

> with your bear hands

...

> bear hands

{{champion:106}}
{{champion:36}} {{champion:223}} {{champion:238}}

Literally every champ can snowball out of control.

I've seen Galios do it if you don't properly put him down during lane phase.
galio is op
{{champion:74}} isn't op. your entire team just has to put all their effort into stopping him all game
Heimerdinger falls off pretty bad late game (at least his damage does, I could   see his ult grenade being a game changer but no one ever uses it)
I do use it :'(
{{champion:75}}  ?

That's a fair and reasonable statement to make for hyper carries.

Though it's not fair or reasonable for hyper carries to be strong all game. (>_>)
More like "i could deal with X i just dont trust my team to not get crushed by them too". All my bans right there.
Darius in my previous games said this to us haha
"This Champ is OP I'm Bronze 5 and know how to use only 1 of my abilities correctly!"
Hey Bronze 5 is about 90% Teemo mains and he only has one active ability so that's accurate

He has 3 active abilities, this is a common misconception. Just because something isn't a skill shot doesn't mean it should be spammed whenever off cooldown at random

However this is only something high elo players will know
https://encrypted-tbn2.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRsgPnTzyz3rRgrs4yx3d5g2a25QZSBu900Do9CYzBtsHNIiuN_
I laughed too hard on this one :')

"All champions have counterplay"

They do, but if that counterplay actively hurts your chances of winning, does it really count?
As an example, if {{champion:420}} ults, you can walk out to avoid damage. The problem occurs when you realize there are four other people on her team doing damage while yours withdraws. 
At this point, you've kept her ult from winning the teamfight. However, depending on how low your team is, there's a good chance you've lost the fight anyway.

Champions have to be considered in more than a 1v1 perspective.
If {{champion:420}} gets a 5-6 man ult then it's your fault for clumping together like hamsters.
That's why ori and malphite Ults are bad right?
Illaoi doesn't have a long-range dash or a remote-controlled minion
Flash

If you walk out to avoid damage from Ziggs Ult, Pantheon's Ult, Fiddlesticks Ult, Zyra's Ult, Amumu's Ult, Miss Fortune's Ult, Any AoE Damage/CC in the Game which is to much to mention...

Damn, guess almost everyone is OP by your standard.

I guess what you are saying is if you can't just stand where ever you want for as long as you want dealing all the damage you want... because an Enemy used an Ability... then that Enemy is brokenly OP because it hurts you to counter play?

20 bucks says if I op.gg the op he's bronze/silver :/.

Oh boy, 3,000 game unranked aram warrior. 

It's sad that I don't even get surprised anymore.

> [{quoted}](name=CaptnJakSparrow,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=scLHBwEj,comment-id=0020,timestamp=2016-02-01T02:15:54.311+0000)
>
> 20 bucks says if I op.gg the op he's bronze/silver :/.
> 
> Oh boy, 3,000 game unranked aram warrior. 
> 
> It's sad that I don't even get surprised anymore.

You talk as if rank actually means something in this game.
It kinda does. If he plays 90% ARAM and never touched ranked then he really doesnt have authority to make conclusions on champion balance
why did this get downvoted? ARAM is a horrible environment for determining champion balance.
